original_title: SLPP defectors have not managed to attract party voter base: Sanjeewa Edirimanna
original_body_lines: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Sanjeewa Edirimanna says those who defected from the party have failed to take the party’s voter base along with them. This the MP said was evident from the labour day rallies held by the groups.
“The Freedom People’s Congress was not even able to attract 1% of their voter base for their rally held in Kandy,” he said. “Many were curious if they would take along the SLPP voter base with them.

These concerns were valid as several of them were powerful political figures. But the May Day rallies have proved otherwise,” he added. The MP made these comments at a party press conference held in Colombo yesterday.

“They held the rally in Kandy. Two of their stalwarts are from the town. But if they had managed to bring in at least 1% of their voter base around 1500 would have been attendance at the rally. But was there even 0.2% there?” Edirimanna asked. He said similarly Wimal Weerawansa and Udaya Gammanpila of the Supreme Lanka Coalition failed to attract even 000.1% of their voter base for the rally held in Colombo on the day. In comparison, Edirimanna said the SLPP rally was the most successful one of the day.
“Though we faced obstacles due to violence unleashed on our members in the recent past we were able to hold the rally successfully in the Campbell Park,” he noted.
